section.name: Mailing Lists - Guidelines
section.p: Before subscribing to any of the mailing lists, please make sure that you have read and understand the guidelines.
Please note that usage of these mailing lists is subject to the Public Forum Archive Policy.
For details of how to subscribe/unsubscribe please read Subscribing and Unsubscribing

section.name: JMeter lists and archives at the ASF
section.p: The following mailing lists are available:

subsection.name: Apache JMeter User
subsection.p: This is the list where users of Apache JMeter meet and discuss issues.
Developers are also expected to be lurking on this list to offer support to users of JMeter.
This list starts part-way through Nov 2011, when JMeter became an independent Apache project. For old postings, please see the Jakarta JMeter User list, below.

ul.li: Send your message to: user@jmeter.apache.org (after the subscription process)

subsection.name: Apache JMeter Developer
subsection.p: This is the list where participating developers meet and discuss issues, code changes/additions etc.
subsection.note: Please do not send usage questions to this list, see user list above.
subsection.p: This list also collects Wiki update messages.
This list starts part-way through Nov 2011, when JMeter became an independent Apache project. For earlier postings, please see below.

ul.li: Send your message to: dev@jmeter.apache.org (after the subscription process)
